com.analog.lyric.dimple.solvers.junctiontree

Class JunctionTreeSolverGraphBase<Delegate extends ISolverFactorGraph>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.options.AbstractOptionHolder
      • com.analog.lyric.options.LocalOptionHolder
        • com.analog.lyric.dimple.options.DimpleOptionHolder
          • com.analog.lyric.dimple.events.SolverEventSource
            • com.analog.lyric.dimple.solvers.core.proxy.ProxySolverNode<Delegate>
              • com.analog.lyric.dimple.solvers.core.proxy.ProxySolverFactorGraph<Delegate>
                • com.analog.lyric.dimple.solvers.junctiontree.JunctionTreeSolverGraphBase<Delegate>
  • Type Parameters:
    Delegate - specifies the type of the solver that will be used on the transformed graph and to which this solver will delegate.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDimpleEnvironmentHolder, IDimpleEventSource, ISolverEventSource, IProxySolverNode<Delegate>, ISolverFactorGraph, ISolverNode, IOptionHolder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JunctionTreeMAPSolverGraph, JunctionTreeSolverGraph

    public abstract class JunctionTreeSolverGraphBase<Delegate extends ISolverFactorGraph>
extends ProxySolverFactorGraph<Delegate>
    Base class for solver graphs using junction tree algorithm to transform graph into a tree for exact inference using belief propagation.
    Since:
    0.05

      • getNumIterations

        public int getNumIterations()

        For the junction tree solver, the number of iterations is always one. Additional iterations should not modify the result.

        Specified by:

      • useConditioning

        public boolean useConditioning()
        If true, then the transformation will condition out any variables that have a fixed value. This will produce a more efficient graph but will prevent it from being reused if the fixed value changes.

        False by default.

        See Also:
        useConditioning(boolean)

      • useConditioning

        public JunctionTreeSolverGraphBase<Delegate> useConditioning(boolean yes)
        Sets useConditioning() to specified value.
        Returns:
        this

      • variableEliminatorCostFunctions

        public VariableEliminator.CostFunction[] variableEliminatorCostFunctions()
        The cost functions used by VariableEliminator to determine the variable elimination ordering. If empty (the default), then all of the standard VariableEliminator.VariableCost functions will be tried.
        See Also:
        variableEliminatorCostFunctions(VariableEliminator.CostFunction...), variableEliminatorCostFunctions(VariableEliminator.VariableCost...)

      • variableEliminatorCostFunctions

      • variableEliminatorCostFunctions

        @Matlab
public JunctionTreeSolverGraphBase<Delegate> variableEliminatorCostFunctions(java.lang.String... costFunctionNames)

      • maxTransformationAttempts

        public int maxTransformationAttempts()
        Specifies the maximum number of times to attempt to determine an optimal junction tree transformation.

        Specifies the number of iterations of the VariableEliminator algorithm when attempting to determine the variable elimination ordering that determines the junction tree transformation. Each iteration will pick a cost function from variableEliminatorCostFunctions() at random and will randomize the order of variables that have equivalent costs. A higher number of iterations may produce a better ordering.

        Default value is specified by JunctionTreeTransform.DEFAULT_MAX_TRANSFORMATION_ATTEMPTS.

        See Also:
        maxTransformationAttempts(int)

      • maxTransformationAttempts

        public JunctionTreeSolverGraphBase<Delegate> maxTransformationAttempts(int iterations)
        Sets maxTransformationAttempts() to the specified value.
        Returns:
        this
